etymology.description: 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") = taking the ear of prey (hunter's rite) -> to take

examples.chinese: 他取了钥匙(他取了鑰匙)。
图书管理员从书架上取下图书(圖書管理員從書架上取下圖書)，交给借书的人(交給借書的人)。
examples.pinyin: Túshū guǎnlǐyuán cóng shūjià shàng qǔ xià túshū, jiāo gěi jièshū de rén.
examples.english: The librarian took a book from the shelf and handed it to the borrower.
